Package main.java.progOO2.p09

package main.java.progOO2.p09

Programming Object Oriented II: Debt

This package introduces the concept of modeling financial entities and simulating behavior over time. The Debt class represents a simple financial debt with an interest rate, and provides methods to simulate how the debt grows annually.

Key learning goals:

  • Object state with real-world meaning: The balance and interestRate variables represent meaningful data fields relevant in financial applications.
  • Behavior through methods: The waitOneYear() method changes the internal state of the object to reflect how debt increases over time due to interest.
  • Encapsulation and information hiding: The fields are marked as private, emphasizing that internal state should only be modified via class methods.
  • Separation of concerns: Display logic is kept in printBalance(), while calculation logic is handled by waitOneYear(), helping students design methods with single responsibilities.

This exercise allows students to explore the concept of compound growth, while reinforcing the object-oriented principle that objects can evolve over time through defined behaviors.

Note: The Debt class is intended to demonstrate how a program can simulate time-dependent changes in an object's state.

    Description
    Debt
    Content introduction to object-oriented programming, changing an instance variable's value in a Method
